definitions.definition: ( ambitransitive ) To prepare food for eating by heating it, often combining with other ingredients .

examples: The dinner is cooking on the stove.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , figuratively ) To be uncomfortably hot .
examples: Look at that poor dog shut up in that car on a day like today - it must be cooking in there.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , slang ) To kill , destroy , or otherwise render useless or inoperative through exposure to excessive heat or radiation .
( transitive , slang ) To execute by electric chair .
( transitive , military slang ) To hold on to a grenade briefly after igniting the fuse , so that it explodes almost immediately after being thrown .
examples: I always cook my frags , in case they try to grab one and throw it back.
My brother was locked up for cooking meth in his basement.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , slang ) To tamper with or alter ; to cook up .
( intransitive , jazz , slang ) To play or improvise in an inspired and rhythmically exciting way. (From 1930s jive talk.)
examples: Crank up the Coltrane and start cooking !

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , music , slang ) To play music vigorously .
examples: On the Wagner piece, the orchestra was cooking !

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , slang , humorous ) To proceed with some plan or course of action , or develop some train of thought towards its conclusion (whether this is advantageous , or comical , or digging into a hole ).
examples: Hol' up, let that boy cook !

subdefinitions.definition: ( intransitive , slang , humorous ) To proceed with some advantageous course of action ; ( more generally ) to be successful .
examples: We had to deal with some problems at first, but now we're cooking .

subdefinitions.definition: ( intransitive , slang , derogatory , Australia ) To develop insane or fringe ideas .
examples: The furlough of workers during The Lockdowns left many with a conspiracy bent ample time to cook .

definitions.definition: ( transitive , slang ) To defeat or humiliate .
examples: He didn't prepare for the debate at all, so his opponent cooked him hard.
You didn't have to cook him like that!

definitions.definition: ( transitive , slang ) To cause to be cooked , i.e. to put in a hopeless situation.
examples: This new labor law is really cooking working-class people.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To prepare food for eating by heating it, often combining with other ingredients .

definitions.definition: ( obsolete , rare , intransitive ) To make the noise of the cuckoo .

main_definition: ( obsolete , rare , intransitive ) To make the noise of the cuckoo .
